guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
We were warned about this repeatedly 2000 years ago. It is important to actually read scripture, because in so doing you will avoid traps like the roman catholic church and virtually every other church building in America. I can't speak for the rest of the world.

Also:

>And I personally think democrats/leftists and communist ideas are what's destroying America and the west and also the theology of the church.

Kind of, but to view them as the enemy or to point the finger at them is to fall for the trap of the left/right paradigm.  It has nothing to do with either party but rather the system itself.

As for the theology of the church, that's quite a complex subject. The Roman Catholic church has basically had it all wrong for a long time now. I don't believe the roman catholic church was something sanctioned by God.

body:
It's the ideas themselves that are the problem. The American system of government is the best in the world founded on christian ideas, "conservatism" (republican party) aims to keep those. The last 4 presidents were all playing for the same corrupt team, but the ideas of conservatism aren't wrong. 

The catholic church was infiltrated by the occult secret societies and as used as a tool of political power. Studying the symbolism and their actions will tell you a lot. Church doesn't work right when the leadership isn't held accountable.

body:
Yes, I agree with that. 

There's a good amount of evidence I think in their writings. 

"...the government was shaped by biblical passages like Isaiah 33:22, writing, “Our nation’s form of government was actually taken from scripture.  ‘The Lord is our Judge {Judicial Branch}…Lawgiver {Legislative Branch}…and King {Executive Branch}.'”

The Founders put God first and foremost in the Declaration of Independence. Federer stated, “It says right in there ‘appealing to the Supreme Judge of the world.’ In this founding document, we appealed to God. We invited Him to be a part of this American experiment.”"  

Individual christians make up The Church. Our body is a temple.

body:
From what I understand, Masons have and do appeal to "God" and the bible in much of what they say, but what they do stands in stark contrast. Similar to our government making "In God We Trust" our motto but that happened approximately when one would expect God to have left the country, 1957 if i remember correctly.

I do agree that the founding fathers did build a system of governance with Christian foundations/ideals, I just don't know if it was done for God or for a more nefarious purpose, considering what appears to be occult involvement by the founding fathers.

parent.body:
We were warned about this repeatedly 2000 years ago. It is important to actually read scripture, because in so doing you will avoid traps like the roman catholic church and virtually every other church building in America. I can't speak for the rest of the world.

Also:

>And I personally think democrats/leftists and communist ideas are what's destroying America and the west and also the theology of the church.

Kind of, but to view them as the enemy or to point the finger at them is to fall for the trap of the left/right paradigm.  It has nothing to do with either party but rather the system itself.

As for the theology of the church, that's quite a complex subject. The Roman Catholic church has basically had it all wrong for a long time now. I don't believe the roman catholic church was something sanctioned by God.

body:
>None of my questions were difficult but you didnt answer any of them.

Your questions were deflections (how your kind operates), and I did answer; there are several "brands" of Christianity. And you didn't answer because a) you're a deceitful and dishonest person (a prerequisite for being a Christian and b) you don't even know the bacics of your own faith (a prerequisite for being an Evangelical Christian), and can't answer even if you wanted to. And "Christian" is not a brand, branch or denomination of Christianity. Catholics are also Christians. What about it?

And of course you'd use the KJV. The most ignorant Christians tend to. If they are really dumb, they also claim it's inerrent and/or inspired (hopefully that's not you), despite not speaking a word of Hebrew or Greek. And the KJV is an Anglican translation, literally Catholicism lite, with a monarch instead of a pope. And yes, the KJV is indeed based on the Catholic canon, and also contained the Apocrypha until the 19th century before it was removed thanks to the British and Foreign Bible Society. 

And the pope doesn't know who you are, and probably couldn't care less about you.

So again, Do you believe in the satanic trinity abomination? We've already established you believe in a second God besides the Most High despite the clear-cut commandment to acknowledge and worship the one God alone. So is there a God #3 there too? Do you believe in the trinity abomination, yes or no? 

Do you believe Jesus is fully God and fully man? Yes or no?

Who compiled and canonized your Bible, and according to which self-professed authority? What's its foundation?

body:
Yeah, Republican-infested protestantism is bullshit too, but what about the original that came before the RCC? It's the only thing worthy imo.

> Who compiled and canonized your Bible?

Well I've done quite a bit of research and I am confident that most of it was written by reputable sources. But the content is self-evident regardless.

> Do you believe in the satanic trinity abomination?

Yes, and how is it a satanic abomination?

> Do you believe Jesus is fully God and fully man?

Yes

> Which form of Christianity do you follow?

No denomination, because that means your allegiance is to that denomination instead. Church gatherings are important but there's been WAY too much emphasis on it ever since the Romans invaded Christianity, and serious structural changes too (mostly the sit down and be quiet and listen to the priest stuff). It's mostly just another excuse for centralization of power by a person or secular organization.

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
